psychosis.description: I feel unsettled and anxious after hearing clinical terms about Ivan's behavior, questioning my safety and his ability to control himself.

psychosis.topic: Difficulty reconciling partner's actions with loyalty
psychosis.description: I struggle to reconcile Ivan's abusive behavior with my loyalty and commitment, making it challenging to act in my own best interest.
I rely on work to distract myself from anxiety and personal issues, avoiding deeper emotional processing.
I suppress my emotions and avoid dwelling on my feelings, attempting to cope with overwhelming situations.

psychosis.topic: Engaging in therapy as a coping strategy
psychosis.description: I participate in couple's therapy and individual therapy to address my anxiety and the complexities of my relationship with Ivan.
I hold a core belief that I am unlovable, which affects my self-worth and decisions in my relationship.
I find Ivan's behavior confusing, particularly reconciling his willingness to change with past abusive actions, which leads to emotional conflict.
I distance myself from friends and family who advise me to leave Ivan, feeling conflicted between loyalty to my partner and external pressures.
